title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 552.1 - Background and intent
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 552.1 - Background and intent

State Regulations
(a) The Office of

Mental Health (OMH) is accountable to the public for the resources provided to
carry out services within State-licensed or operated facilities and program
units that fall under its auspice. OMH has the responsibility to apply
resources efficiently, effectively and economically to achieve the purposes for
which the resources were appropriated. (b) The purpose of this Part is to establish
standards for the administration of audits which are conducted to measure the
extent of compliance with applicable fiscal, administrative and program
requirements. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 14
ยง
552.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
